P. tuberculatum Jacq. is a Piperaceae of economic and medicinal importance, popularly known as “monkey pepper”, found in regions of the states: Amazonas, Rondônia, Pará, Maranhão, Piauí, Ceará, Paraíba, Pernambuco, Rio de Janeiro and Mato Grosso. It is used empirically as sedative antidote for snake venom ( 14) and in the treatment of stomach disorders ( 15).
